sen.j: 實川 延若（じつかわ えんじゃく、新字体：実川）は、歌舞伎役者の名跡。
sen.e: Enjaku JITSUKAWA is a professional name for kabuki actor.
Enjaku JITSUKAWA is a professional name for kabuki actor.
Enjaku JITSUKAWA is a professional name for kabuki actor.
The stage family name is Kawachiya.
The stage family name is Kawachiya.
The stage family name is Kawachiya.

sen.j: 定紋は重ね井筒、替紋は五つ雁金。
sen.e: Jomon (family crest) is Kasaneizutsu and kaemon (alternate personal crest) is Itsutsukarigane.
Jomon (family crest) is Kasaneizutsu and kaemon (alternate personal crest) is Itsutsukarigane.
Jomon (family crest) is Kasaneizutsu and kaemon (alternate personal crest) is Itsutsukarigane.

sen.j: 「延若」は師匠だった實川額十郎の俳名に由来する。
sen.e: Enjaku' is originated from the 'Haimyo (also known as Haimei)' (the term originally refers to a pen name as a haiku poet, but it also refers to a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) of the former master Gakujuro JITSUKAWA.

Enjaku' is originated from the Haimyo (also known as Haimei; the term originally refers to a pen name as a haiku poet, but it also refers to a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) of the former master Gakujuro JITSUKAWA.
sen.cmt: 原文に合せて' 'を削除しました。括弧の表記を訂正しました。
sen.e: Enjaku' is originated from the Haimyo (also known as Haimei; the term originally refers to a pen name as a haiku poet, but it also refers to a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) of the former master Gakujuro JITSUKAWA.
Enjaku JITSUKAWA (the first)

sen.j: 芝居茶屋・河内屋庄兵衛の養子、実父は大阪の大工、1831–1885。
sen.e: Adopted son of Shibai jaya (A tea house (chaya) located within a theater) Shobe KAWACHIYA, and his real father was a carpenter in Osaka; 1831-1885.
Adopted son of the owner of Shibaijaya (a tea house located within a theater), Shobe KAWACHIYA, and his real father was a carpenter in Osaka; 1831 - 1885.
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。スペース補足しました。
sen.e: Adopted son of the owner of Shibaijaya (a tea house located within a theater), Shobe KAWACHIYA, and his real father was a carpenter in Osaka; 1831 - 1885.

sen.j: 實川延次 → 初代實川延二郎 → 尾上梅幸 → 初代實川延若。
sen.e: Enji JITSUKAWA => Enjiro JITSUKAWA the first => Baiko ONOE => Enjaku JITSUKAWA the first.
